Bash(git -C "C:\\Users\\BenBalbale\\CascadeProjects\\SigmaSight" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Add Symbol Metrics Service and Validation \(Phases 5-6\)

Phase 5: Symbol Metrics Service
- Created app/services/symbol_metrics_service.py
- Calculates returns \(1d, MTD, YTD, 1m, 3m, 1y\) for all symbols
- Fetches company profiles and factor exposures
- Bulk upserts to symbol_daily_metrics table
- Provides load_symbol_returns\(\) for P&L calculator lookups

Phase 5: Batch Orchestrator Integration
- Added Phase 1.75 after symbol factors, before P&L calculation
- Pre-computes symbol returns for efficient P&L lookups
- Populates symbol_daily_metrics for Symbol Dashboard

Phase 6: Validation Script
- Created scripts/validation/compare_factor_exposures.py
- Compares position-level vs symbol-level factor calculations
- Reports match rate and discrepancies
- Generates recommendation for deprecation readiness

Architecture now has 9 phases:
Phase 0: Company Profiles
Phase 1: Market Data
Phase 1.5: Symbol Factors
Phase 1.75: Symbol Metrics \(NEW\)
Phase 2-6: Portfolio processing

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "C:\\Users\\BenBalbale\\CascadeProjects\\SigmaSight" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: Remove orphan AI learning migrations from Core DB

Deleted migrations that were incorrectly created in migrations_core/:
- l9m0n1o2p3q4_add_ai_learning_tables.py
- m9n0o1p2q3r4_switch_to_hnsw_index.py

These migrations were orphans \(not in the main migration chain\) and
created AI tables \(ai_kb_documents, ai_memories, ai_feedback\) in the
wrong database. These tables belong only in the AI database \(metro\),
which has its own migration in migrations_ai/0001_initial_ai_schema.py.

Also updated Railway Core DB alembic_version to n0o1p2q3r4s5.

Bash(git -C "C:\\Users\\BenBalbale\\CascadeProjects\\SigmaSight" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Extend factor and metrics calculations to full symbol universe

Updated both symbol_factors.py and symbol_metrics_service.py to include
all symbols from market_data_cache \(S&P 500, Nasdaq 100, Russell 2000\)
in addition to portfolio positions.

Changes:
- symbol_factors.py:get_all_active_symbols\(\)
  Now queries both positions table AND market_data_cache
  ~1,188 symbols will get factor betas calculated \(vs ~60 before\)

- symbol_metrics_service.py:get_all_active_symbols\(\)
  Now queries both symbol_universe AND market_data_cache
  ~1,188 symbols will get returns calculated \(YTD, MTD, 1d, etc.\)

This enables:
- Equity Search to sort/filter by factor betas for entire universe
- What-if analysis for symbols not yet in portfolios
- Pre-computed metrics for faster dashboard queries

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "C:\\Users\\BenBalbale\\CascadeProjects\\SigmaSight" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: Batch symbol_daily_metrics inserts to avoid PostgreSQL limit

PostgreSQL has a 32,767 parameter limit per query. With 1,188 symbols
and 29 columns each \(34,452 params\), we exceeded this limit.

Fixed by batching inserts into chunks of 500 rows \(14,500 params each\),
well under the limit. This ensures Phase 1.75 can handle the full
~1,188 symbol universe.

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
